intro: Achyranthes globulifera, commonly known as the globe thorn-apple, is a tropical plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its distinctive, globe-shaped seed pods that contain a single seed. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and inconspicuous. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
